intro: Euryloma capax, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its rosette-shaped leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically produces vibrant purple, pink, or white blooms that attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Euryloma capax thrives in moist, well-drained soil and requires indirect sunlight for optimal growth. Its compact size and ornamental value make it a popular houseplant worldwide.
